You can already do this: https://github.com/tensorflow/tensorflow/blob/r1.10/tensorflow/python/training/device_setter.py#L97 https://stackoverflow.com/questions/39666845/how-does-tf-train-replica-device-setter-work Brian Patton | Software Engineer | bjp@google.com | +1 (360) 903-9003
…
On Tue, Aug 28, 2018 at 1:50 PM Sebastian Weiss ***@***.***> wrote: That would be an awesome feature. Some per-operation flag that specifies whether the GPU or CPU version should be selected by default. To my knowledge, if a GPU version is available, that one is always selected. @rmlarsen <https://github.com/rmlarsen> what do you think? — You are receiving this because you are subscribed to this thread. On Tue, Aug 28, 2018 at 1:50 PM Sebastian Weiss ***@***.***> wrote:
 That would be an awesome feature. Some per-operation flag that specifies
 whether the GPU or CPU version should be selected by default. To my
 knowledge, if a GPU version is available, that one is always selected.
 @rmlarsen <https://github.com/rmlarsen> what do you think?

body:
You can already do this:
https://github.com/tensorflow/tensorflow/blob/r1.10/tensorflow/python/training/device_setter.py#L97
https://stackoverflow.com/questions/39666845/how-does-tf-train-replica-device-setter-work

Brian Patton | Software Engineer | bjp@google.com | +1 (360) 903-9003



On Tue, Aug 28, 2018 at 1:50 PM Sebastian Weiss <notifications@github.com>
wrote:

> That would be an awesome feature. Some per-operation flag that specifies
> whether the GPU or CPU version should be selected by default. To my
> knowledge, if a GPU version is available, that one is always selected.
> @rmlarsen <https://github.com/rmlarsen> what do you think?
